MeetMe: Chat & Meet New People.Security Practices:
Reasonable precautions aimed at protecting personal information from loss, misuse, unauthorized access, disclosure, alteration, and destruction.
Implementing appropriate technical and organizational measures to ensure a level of security appropriate to the risk.
Regularly updating and upgrading security technology to stay current with new threats and vulnerabilities.
Limiting access to personal data only to those employees who need it to perform their job functions.
Implementing strict verification and authentication processes for users attempting to access their accounts.
Encrypting sensitive data, such as passwords and financial information, using industry-standard encryption methods.
Regularly monitoring and testing the effectiveness of security measures to identify and address vulnerabilities.
Providing users with tools and resources to help them protect their own accounts, such as multi-factor authentication and account lockout policies.
Implementing a process for responding to security incidents, including notifying affected users and taking steps to mitigate any potential harm.
Compliance with relevant data protection laws and regulations, including the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), UK GDPR, and Swiss Data Protection Law.
Deidentification of Data: The company ensures that deidentified data is maintained and used in deidentified form, and they do not attempt to re-identify the information except for determining whether their deidentification processes are adequate.
Adequate Protection of Data Transfers: The company ensures that personal data transferred outside the EEA/UK/Swiss is adequately protected either because the European Commission has decided that the country to which personal data are transferred ensures an adequate level of protection or the transfer is subject to appropriate safeguards (e.g., standard data protection clauses of the European Union agreed on with the recipient).
Consent Management Platform (CMP): The company provides a CMP to prevent cookies or other tracking mechanisms which are not strictly necessary from tracking user activity on their Sites or in their Mobile Apps. Users can withdraw their consent at any time with effect for the future.
Browser Signals: The company respects browser signals such as the 'global privacy control' (GPC) signal and applies it to opt that particular browser out of targeting cookies on their Sites.
Industry Ad Choice Programs: Users can control how participating third-party ad companies use the information they collect about user visits to the company's Sites and those of third parties, in order to display more relevant targeted advertising to them.
Data Retention Policies: The company has data retention policies in place as they mention deidentified data and the need to determine whether their deidentification processes are adequate, suggesting that they do not retain identifiable data for an unnecessarily long period.
Data Protection Agreements: The company intends to agree on additional measures with recipients to ensure an adequate level of data protection, as well as concluding a corresponding 'UK Addendum' and 'CH Addendum' with their contractual partners in accordance with the requirements of the respective data protection authorities.
Compliance with legal obligations: The organization ensures it complies with all relevant laws and regulations regarding personal data protection.
Performance of tasks in the public interest or exercise of official authority: The organization processes personal data for specific purposes that serve the public interest or are mandated by law or official authorities.
Archiving, scientific research, historical research, or statistical purposes: Personal data may be processed for archival, research, or statistical purposes, which can help advance knowledge and understanding in various fields.
Restriction of processing: Users have the right to restrict the processing of their personal data under certain circumstances, such as when the accuracy of the data is contested, processing is unlawful, or the data is required for part of a legal process.
Right to object to processing: Users can object to processing in specific circumstances, including tasks carried out in the public interest, the exercise of official authority, or the organization's legitimate interests (or those of a third party).
Data portability: If personal data is processed based on user consent or for the performance of a contract, and the processing is automated, users have the right to receive their data in a structured, commonly used format and to transmit that data to another controller.
Appointment of a Swiss representative: The organization has appointed Treforma AG as its Swiss representative under Art. 14 nFADP for data protection matters.
Transfers of personal information outside of Switzerland: The organization provides details on the protection and safeguards applied to personal data when it is transferred outside of Switzerland, as mentioned in Section 5 Transfers of personal data in the context of countries located outside the EEA/UK/CH.
Right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority: Users have the right to file a complaint with the competent data protection supervisory authority in Switzerland, which is the Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC).

Magicabin: Witch's Adventure.Security Practices:
Data Controller: PhotonFox
Confidentiality: Personal data is treated confidentially and protected.
Secure Transmission: Data is transmitted securely using encrypted connections (HTTPS) for online services.
Data Encryption: Stored data is in an encrypted format to prevent unauthorized access and modifications.
Third-Party Service Providers: PhotonFox works with service providers who are contractually obligated to keep users' personal data confidential and comply with relevant data protection laws.
Data Protection Policies for Partners: When sharing data, partners must have their own privacy policies in place to protect user data.
Data Processing Agreements (DPAs): PhotonFox has DPAs with service providers that outline specific terms for processing personal data on their behalf. Users can request a copy of these agreements.
Security Measures: Appropriate technical and organizational measures are implemented to ensure a level of security appropriate to the risk, including procedures for dealing with any suspected data breach.
Data Retention: Personal data is only kept for as long as necessary or required by law, after which it is deleted or anonymized.
User Control Over Data: Users have the right to access, correct, delete, limit processing, object to processing, and withdraw consent for certain uses such as marketing emails or targeted ads.

Smart Search & Web Browser.Security Practices:
Data Collection Limitation: Reactive Phone only collects necessary Personal Information for providing services.
Server Security: User information is stored securely on servers, which may be hosted by third-party service providers with appropriate security measures in place.
Data Encryption: Data transmitted between the user and the application might be encrypted according to industry standards.
Access Restrictions: Strict restrictions are placed on access to user data, with a limited number of Reactive Phone employees having access to it.
Third-Party Service Providers: These partners can only use information collected on behalf of Reactive Phone and are required to ensure that any information collected is anonymized and aggregated before they are permitted to use such information.
Password Protection: Users may be required to create passwords for certain Services offered via the Application, helping protect their accounts from unauthorized access.
Cookies and URL Information: The use of cookies and URL information is governed by the privacy policy, with an option for users to remove persistent cookies by following Internet browser help file directions.
Data Anonymization: Non-Personal Information, Potentially Personal Information, and Aggregate Data are used in a way that they no longer reflect or reference an individually identifiable user.
User Consent: Reactive Phone obtains user consent before collecting, using, or sharing Personal Information.
Opt-Out Options: Users have the option to opt out of certain data collection practices such as location tracking and push notifications.
Regular Updates and Notifications: Reactive Phone may update this Privacy Policy from time to time and will notify users through standard mechanisms such as app notifications or email.
Compliance with Laws: Reactive Phone complies with applicable laws regarding data protection and privacy, including those in the United States and other countries where users may be located.
Data Retention Policy: Reactive Phone retains user data for as long as necessary to provide services, comply with legal obligations, resolve disputes, and enforce agreements. After this period, user data is deleted or anonymized.

Opera GX: Gaming Browser.Security Practices:
Data Controller & Processor: Opera Norway AS acts as the primary data controller, while other companies within the Opera Group act as data processors. They apply GDPR to their internal processing.

Legal Basis: The privacy policy outlines four legal bases for processing personal data: consent, contractual grounds, legitimate interest, and legal compliance.

Data Encryption: Certain data may be encrypted during transmission to ensure its protection.

Third-Party Data Processors: Opera uses third-party technology providers for various purposes, such as marketing messages, managing the Cashback program, and powering AI-powered chat assistants like Aria. These providers are expected to have their own security measures in place to protect user data.

Consent & Opt-Out Options: Users are asked for consent before their data is processed for certain purposes, such as marketing communications or sharing data with third parties. They can opt-out from receiving marketing communication at any time and manage their preferences via the settings menu.

Data Retention: Opera does not retain user data longer than necessary for the specific purpose it was collected for, unless there are legal requirements to do so (e.g., payment-related data may be stored for up to five years due to regulatory requirements).

Secure Servers: The policy mentions that servers used for syncing browser data between devices do not retain this data.

Data Protection Agreements: Opera has data protection agreements in place with third-party service providers, ensuring they process user data in accordance with applicable laws and regulations.

Data Controller Responsibilities: Opera takes responsibility as a data controller for the personal data it collects and processes, and users can make inquiries or requests regarding their personal data by sending an email to datacontroller@yoyogames.com.

Secure Payment Processing: Payment service providers used by Opera are responsible for securely processing payments and storing related data, with regulatory requirements dictating that this data may be stored for up to five years.

Data Protection Policies: Opera has a Cookie Policy and other privacy-related documents in place to inform users about how their data is collected, used, and protected. Links to these policies are provided within the excerpt.

Data Protection Officer: They have a designated Data Protection Officer who can be contacted for any questions about privacy issues in their applications or services.

VIVOSUN.Security Practices:
Vivosun implements the following security practices and measures:
1. Information Collection: User information is collected only when it is knowingly provided, such as subscribing to their newsletter.
2. Use of Information: Collected information is used solely for processing orders, informing email subscribers and customers about special offers, and will not be sold, shared, or rented without the user's authorization.
3. Security: Sensitive information (like credit card numbers) is encrypted using secure socket layer technology (SSL) during transmission and protected by accepted industry standards to ensure data security both during transmission and once received.
4. Order Processing: To process orders, Vivosun shares personal and financial information with their merchant bank for authorization and approval, which is protected by an enhanced security system.
5. Data Deletion: Users have the option to delete their contact information from their Vivosun account or request data deletion through customer service.
6. Customer Service Contact: Users can contact Vivosun's customer service for assistance regarding security on their website.
7. Fraud Awareness: There is a dedicated section in the policy addressing fraud awareness.
8. Privacy Policy and Terms of Service: The policy includes links to both their Privacy Policy and Terms of Service.

Plant Identifier & Care - Greg.Security Practices:
Data Collection Limitation: Collect only necessary personal data for providing services and improving user experience.
Data Storage Security: Store personal data securely with appropriate technical and organizational measures to prevent unauthorized access, disclosure, alteration, or destruction.
Data Processing: Process personal data in a manner that ensures appropriate security measures are in place to prevent unauthorized or unlawful processing and against accidental loss or destruction.
Data Transfer Security: Use secure methods to protect personal data during transmission.
Data Retention: Retain personal data only for as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes outlined in the privacy policy or as required by law.
Data Protection Policies and Procedures: Establish policies and procedures to ensure that employees who access personal data are properly trained on data protection practices and bound by confidentiality agreements.
Third-Party Service Providers: Engage third-party service providers to process personal data, but only if those providers offer sufficient guarantees that appropriate technical and organizational measures are in place to protect the user's personal data.
Data Breach Response Plan: Have a plan in place to respond to any potential data breaches, including notifying affected users and relevant authorities as required by law.
User Control Over Personal Data: Provide users with control over their personal data, with the ability to access, update, or delete it as needed.
Regular Review and Update of Security Measures: Regularly review and update security measures to ensure they remain effective in protecting user data.
Legal and regulatory compliance: Ensure compliance with all applicable laws and regulations regarding the handling of personal data.
Fraud and crime prevention: Use personal data to prevent fraudulent activities and crimes.
Internal or external audits: Conduct internal and external audits to ensure proper handling and protection of personal data.
Use of Cookies: Use cookies for various purposes, including authentication, status, personalization, security, advertising, diagnosis, analysis, and cookie consent.
Data anonymization or de-identification: Anonymize or de-identify personal data and use such information for business purposes.
Limiting data collection: Collect personal data only when explicitly provided by users, and do not request confidential, proprietary, secret, or legally protected information unless necessary.
Data protection during transmission: Use secure methods for transmitting personal data to protect it from unauthorized access during transfer.
Third-party data protection: Ensure that third parties provide such data in a secure manner and comply with relevant privacy laws and regulations when obtaining information about users from outside sources.
User consent: Obtain valid consent from users before collecting and processing their personal data for purposes other than those mentioned in the policy.
Confidentiality and Integrity of Data: Process personal data lawfully, fairly, and in a transparent manner, and it will be accurate, kept up-to-date, and relevant to the purposes for which they were collected.
Access Control: Only authorized personnel have access to user's personal data.
Data Portability: Provide users with the right to receive a copy of their personal data upon request.
Data Erasure: Allow users to request erasure of their personal data under certain circumstances.
Data Restriction: Allow users to restrict the processing of their personal data in some circumstances.
Data Protection Officer: Appoint a Privacy Officer to handle data protection matters and ensure compliance with applicable data protection laws.
Third-Party Disclosure: Share personal data with other entities, but allow users to opt-out of such sharing.
Data Security Breach Notification: Users have the right to complain to a supervisory authority responsible for data protection if they consider that processing of their personal data infringes data protection laws.
Opt-out Mechanism: Allow users to opt-out from receiving emails about special offers and other promotions or from sharing their personal data with other entities by following the instructions provided in the policy.
Data Processing Agreement (DPA): Have a contract in place to ensure compliance with data protection laws when personal data is processed by third parties (upon request).
Data Retention Policies: Personal data will not be kept for longer than is necessary for its intended purpose(s). The retention period may vary depending on the performance of services and applicable industry and governmental standards.
Opt-Out Option for Direct Marketing: California residents have the right to request that their personal data not be disclosed to third parties for their direct marketing purposes.
Data Deletion Rights: California residents have the right to have their personal data deleted, subject to certain exceptions.
No Discrimination for Exercising Rights: The organization will not discriminate against users if they exercise any of their rights under the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA). However, exercising certain rights may impact the organization's ability to provide services to the user.
Contact Information for Questions or Changes in Notice: Users can contact the organization for questions or changes regarding the privacy policy. The organization may elect to change or amend their Privacy Policy and will post any notice changes on their website or app.

SHAREit Lite - Fast File Share.Security Practices:
Data collection and usage: Personal information is collected for specific purposes with user consent, and additional information is required to process requests. The service does not intentionally collect personal data from children under 13 years old (or the age of consent as required by law).

Strong protection for user privacy: Robust safeguards are implemented including encryption, secure connections, access controls, data minimization, third-party service providers contractually obligated to implement appropriate security measures, regular audits and assessments, data retention policies, user control over data, a data breach response plan, compliance with laws and regulations, and specific requirements for certain jurisdictions (e.g., Indonesia and Nigeria).

Data storage and processing: Personal data is stored on servers located in Singapore or the United States, with appropriate safeguards in place to provide adequate protection for the personal data, especially when transferring data outside of the user's jurisdiction.

User rights: Users have certain rights regarding their personal data including accessing, correcting, deleting, restricting processing, objecting to certain processing methods, transferring data to third parties, withdrawing consent, and filing complaints with local data protection authorities.

Data retention: Personal data is stored as long as there is a relationship between the user and the company. After the relationship ends, data is kept as required by law or for investigative purposes, business analysis and audits, legal claims handling, or record-keeping for potential future disputes.

Contact information: Users can contact the service provider for any privacy-related questions or concerns at the provided email address (slite@ushareit.com). They commit to working with users to resolve privacy issues.

Notepad - simple notes.Security Practices:
The Notepad Free app employs the following security practices and user rights: 
1. Secure storage of notes within the app's internal storage, accessible only by the user.
2. Encrypted backup of notes using Google device backup (optional) and stored on Google Drive.
3. Protection of email addresses by not storing them outside the email service provider (Outlook.com), with optional sending of note titles for diagnostic purposes.
4. Anonymized IP addresses in analytics to protect user privacy.
5. Use of unique Advertising IDs for personalized ads, but no demographics or interests data is collected. Users in EEA have the option to choose between personalized and non-personalized ads.
6. Option for users to delete their data used by analytic tools upon request through the app's 'Privacy settings' screen or by email.
7. Reflection of policy changes in updates to this document.

Kilonotes-Notes & PDF reading.Security Practices:
Data Collection: Personal information is collected only for specific purposes such as service operation, improvement, optimization, and account security.

Data Retention: Necessary data is retained for as long as needed to satisfy the outlined purposes, and users have the right to request deletion of their personal data.
Policy Updates: The privacy policy may change frequently; users are advised to check for updates regularly.
Data Protection: Strict confidentiality agreements ensure that third parties handle personal information in accordance with instructions, this Privacy Policy, and other relevant measures.
User Control: Users can cancel their accounts or contact customer service for questions, comments, or suggestions regarding the use of Kilonotes and this Privacy Policy.

DIY Craft Warehouse.Security Practices:
DIY Craft Warehouse implements the following security practices and user rights to protect user data: 
	1. Secure Payment Processing with high-level security payment processors, no credit card number storage for online orders, and direct entry of credit card numbers for telephone orders.
	2. Email-Based Support for sensitive information protection.
	3. Collection and storage of tax-related information to comply with sales tax regulations.
	4. Data collection and storage for tracking rewards and discount programs.
	5. User data collection for distributing coupons or promotional offers.
	6. Personal data collection for efficient return processing.
	7. Data collection for determining eligibility for free shipping based on order value.
	8. Collection and storage of user information submitted through the contact form.
	9. System security measures during non-operating hours to prevent unauthorized access or data breaches.
	10. Data collection for efficient order management and delivery (lead times).
	11. Personal data collection of bloggers and influencers for collaboration purposes.
	Users have the right to review the privacy policy for more detailed information on how their personal data is protected, request data deletion, opt out, or control access to their personal information.

Design Space: DIY with Cricut.Security Practices:
Data Collection Limitation: Cricut collects only necessary personal data for providing services, fulfilling orders, and improving the user experience.
Data Usage Limitation: Collected data will be used for specific purposes such as processing orders, communicating with users, and improving products or services.
Data Sharing Limitation: Cricut shares personal data with third parties only when necessary to fulfill its obligations, improve the user experience, or comply with legal requirements.
Data Security Measures: Cricut takes reasonable measures to protect users' data from loss, misuse, unauthorized access, disclosure, alteration, or destruction. However, specific details about these measures are not provided.
Data Retention: Cricut retains personal data for as long as necessary to fulfill its obligations, maintain business records, and comply with legal requirements. After this period, the data will be deleted or anonymized.
User Control Over Data: Users have the right to access, update, correct, or delete their personal data. They can also object to the processing of their data or withdraw their consent at any time.
Children's Privacy: Cricut does not knowingly collect personal data from children under 13 without obtaining parental consent.
Breach Notification: In case of a data breach, Cricut will notify affected users promptly and take appropriate measures to protect their data.
Compliance with Laws: Cricut complies with all applicable laws regarding the protection of personal data, including the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) in Europe.

Good Pizza, Great Pizza.Security Practices:

Peridot.Security Practices:
Data Access Control: Users can request access to or delete their data through their Niantic Profile settings.
Verification of Requests: User requests are verified via email to ensure the account owner is making the request.
Data Retention: Niantic aims to provide requested information within 30 days, minimizing unnecessary data storage.
Parental Consent for Children: For child-permitted Services, parental consent is required for collection, use, or disclosure of a child's Personal Data. Niantic will delete such information if collected without consent.
Third-Party Service Providers: Niantic uses certified third-party service providers like Kids Web Services (KWS) for certain operations.
Opt-Out Option: Users can review, delete, and refuse further collection, use, and disclosure of their Child’s Personal Data by notifying Niantic.
Notice of Changes: Any changes to this Privacy Policy will be given reasonable notice to users.

My Virtual Pet Shop: Animals.Security Practices:
Data Collection and Use: Tapps collects personal information such as username, email address, and payment information for account creation and service usage. They may also collect non-personal data like usage statistics, device information, and log data to improve their services. Users are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of their login information.

Account Security: Users are prohibited from sharing their accounts or letting anyone else access them to prevent unauthorized access to user data. If a user suspects or becomes aware of any breach in the security of their account, they must immediately notify Tapps and change their login information.

Data Breach Notification: In case of a suspected data breach, users are required to inform Tapps and take necessary actions to secure their accounts.

Prohibited Activities: Tapps prohibits activities such as using cheats, exploits, automation software, bots, hacks, or any unauthorized software designed to modify or interfere with the Services. Unauthorized transferring, trading, selling, or exchanging of Virtual Items or Accounts is also forbidden under these Terms.

Compliance with Data Protection Laws: Tapps complies with applicable international and domestic legislation regarding data protection, including the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and Children's Online Privacy Protection Act (COPPA). They have a process in place to protect children's privacy by not collecting any Personal Information from children without parental consent.

Data Protection: Tapps employs various technical measures to secure user data, such as encryption, firewalls, and regular security updates for their servers and applications. Strong passwords, two-factor authentication, or other methods may be required for secure user authentication. User content is monitored for inappropriate content but assumes no responsibility for it. User data is stored securely with appropriate measures taken to protect against unauthorized access or disclosure of this information.

User Responsibility: Users are responsible for their interactions with other users and that Tapps reserves the right to become involved in disputes between users, but has no obligation to do so. Users are also responsible for keeping their account information secure and confidential.

WorkWhile.Security Practices:
Data Encryption: Sensitive information is encrypted using secure methods by third-party providers like Stripe.
Secure Servers: Personal information collected through the app's referral feature is temporarily stored on WorkWhile's secure servers for processing purposes.

Data Minimization: The platform collects only the minimum amount of personal information necessary to provide its services.
User Consent: Users are asked for explicit consent before accessing certain features, and they can revoke this access at any time through their device's settings.
Legal Compliance: WorkWhile complies with legal obligations, including responding to subpoenas and other legal requests when necessary.
Data Protection Policies: The company has policies in place to protect user data from potential threats such as fraud, unauthorized access, or illegal activities.
Third-Party Service Providers: WorkWhile uses third-party vendors, service providers, contractors, or agents who perform services for them and require access to user information only for the purpose of doing that work.
Data Retention: User data is retained only as long as necessary to provide its services and fulfill business obligations, after which it is deleted or anonymized.
Cookie Policy: WorkWhile uses cookies and similar tracking technologies to collect and store information. Users can find specific information about how these technologies are used and how they can refuse certain cookies in the company's Cookie Policy.
Additional Rights for California Residents: California residents have specific privacy rights, including the right to request access to their personal information and the right to request removal of unwanted data that they publicly post on the service's platforms if they are under 18 years of age and reside in California.
Policy Updates: The policy may be updated from time to time to stay compliant with relevant laws, and users are encouraged to review this policy frequently for updates.
Contact Information: Users can contact WorkWhile at privacy@workwhilejobs.com or by post to Workforce as a Service, Inc., 169 11th St #1, SAN FRANCISCO, CA 94103, United States with any questions or comments about this policy.

Basecamp - Project Management.Security Practices:
Data encryption: Credit card information is submitted directly to the payment processor and not stored on 37signals servers; data transmitted between servers and browsers is encrypted using SSL/TLS; database backups are also encrypted, and for HEY, every field containing personal data is encrypted with its own key, and the disks storing the data keys are encrypted as well.
Access controls: Identity and access are verified when signing up for a 37signals product, and only necessary identifying information such as name, email address, and company name are collected; account access is logged by full IP address for security and fraud prevention purposes, and this login data is kept for as long as the product account is active.
Anti-bot assessments: CAPTCHA is used across applications to mitigate brute force logins and spam protection.
Data retention: Content that users upload or maintain in their 37signals product accounts is stored on servers, but deleted within 60 days after deleting the account; copies of content that has been trashed in user accounts are retained for up to 90 days before purging it from all systems and logs.
Third-party subprocessors: Some third-party subprocessors are used to help run applications and provide services, and a list of these subprocessors can be found on the 37signals website.
Data access restrictions: No 37signals human looks at user content except for limited purposes with express permission, such as when an automated process fails or in response to legal process; they have adopted a data processing addendum with Standard Contractual Clauses to help ensure the protection of user data is treated with the same level as granted under EU privacy law.
Legal compliance: 37signals complies with requests from government authorities only if compelled by legal process or in emergency cases and notifies affected users before disclosing data unless legally prohibited from doing so; they preserve user data when compelled by the U.S. Federal Stored Communications Act, a properly served U.S. subpoena for civil matters, or a warrant, court order, or subpoena before the required preservation period expires.
Data transfer notification: If 37signals is acquired by or merges with another company, users will be notified well in advance of any personal information being transferred or becoming subject to a different privacy policy.
Additional security information can be found in their Security Overview.

Plaky \u2014 Project Management.Security Practices:
Data Retention: Personal information is stored only as long as necessary for its original purpose and other legitimate business purposes, including meeting legal, regulatory, or compliance obligations.

Data Subject Requests: Users have the right to request access, rectification, deletion, restriction, portability, and objection to the processing of their personal data, and can withdraw their consent at any time.

International Data Transfer: Appropriate safeguards are implemented for cross-border transfers as required by applicable law for international data transfers. For transfers originating from the European Economic Area (EEA), Switzerland, or the UK, standard contractual clauses and the international data transfer addendum to the European Commission’s standard contractual clauses are used.

List of Sub-Processors: Third-party entities (sub-processors) are used for processing personal data on behalf of its customers. These sub-processors include Aircall.io, Amazon Web Services, COING DOO, Databricks, Eversign GmbH, Google, Hetzner Online GmbH, Igil Webs SRL, Lempire SA, Microsoft, Pipedrive OÜ, Stripe, Tableau Software, Wistia, Zendesk, and ZenLeads Inc.

Questions or Complaints: Users can contact the company directly for any questions about their personal data processing. For individuals in the EEA, the UK, or Switzerland, they may also contact the Data Protection Officer. If users have a concern that cannot be resolved by the company, they have the right to lodge a complaint with their respective Data Protection Authority.

Nozbe: Tasks & Projects.Security Practices: Data processing is done on an 'as is' basis with necessary measures to ensure safety, including breach notification to authorities and affected users. User data is processed for a limited time and only includes the minimum necessary for creating an Account. Nozbe employees can access user data with explicit consent. Cookies are used for authentication, security, functionality purposes, and targeted advertising or analytics (with user consent). Data encryption is likely used during transmission between the user's device and Nozbe servers, as well as for storing files in S3 infrastructure in Paris, France, and Frankfurt, Germany. Third-party integrations are used, but Nozbe ensures these services are secure and compliant with data protection regulations. Users can control their personal information through a terms and privacy policy that informs them about how their data is collected, used, and protected. Opt-in marketing is used for targeted advertising or analytics purposes, giving users control over their data being used in this manner. Users have the option to contact Customer Support to request a zip archive with all their data kept in the Nozbe system. Account termination is possible at any time through a simple, no-questions-asked process, and user content will be put into a 30-day quarantine before complete removal. Payment data management is secure, with payment gateways like Verifone.com (former 2checkout.com), Stripe, and Przelewy24 (PayPro S.A.) used for credit card transactions, online wire transfers, or PayPal payments. Nozbe does not store credit card numbers in its database. A prohibition of automated methods or scripts for account creation is in place. Age restriction: Users must be at least 13 years old to create an Account and use the Service. Data ownership: Nozbe claims no intellectual property rights over the material User provides in the Application. The user's profile and materials uploaded remain theirs. Data usage restrictions: Users are responsible for using the Service in a legal manner and must not violate any laws in their jurisdiction (including but not limited to copyright laws). Verbal, physical, written or other abuse policy: Abuse of Nozbe customers, employees, members, or officers may result in immediate Account suspension.

ClickUp - Manage Teams & Tasks.Security Practices:
ClickUp implements various security practices and user rights to protect user data as follows:

1. Data Protection: Committed to protecting user data privacy.
2. Consent: Requires explicit permission for data use beyond policy or collection.
3. Opt-out Options: Allows users to opt out of marketing communications and specific data processing activities.
4. Limited Data Collection: Collects data only in accordance with applicable laws, does not sell any data.
5. Information Collected Automatically: Collects non-personally identifiable usage, device, connection, and cookie information for functionality and user recognition.
6. Log Files: Collects non-personally identifiable information for trend analysis, service administration, monitoring use, and gathering demographic info.
7. Cookies and Tracking Technologies: Uses cookies and tracking technologies to provide functionality and recognize users across different Services and devices.
8. Data Encryption: Uses encryption systems for data protection.
9. Access Controls: Limits user information access to those who need it for their tasks.
10. Third-Party Contracts: Requires outside contractors, vendors, and suppliers to protect user information consistent with ClickUp's Privacy Policy.
11. Compliance with Laws: Adheres to applicable laws regarding data use and transfer, including CCPA and CPRA.
12. Data Transfer Practices: Transfers user information in compliance with applicable law, with users voluntarily consenting to trans-border transfer and hosting.
13. Physical Security: Has physical procedures to help safeguard user information.
14. Electronic Security: Has electronic procedures to maintain data security.
15. Managerial Procedures: Has managerial procedures to correctly use user information.
16. Data Retention Policy: Updates, corrects, changes, or deletes users' personal information upon request, but may not be able to remove every record from the system.
17. Verification of Identity: Takes reasonable steps to verify a user's identity before granting profile access or making corrections.
18. Responsibility for Account Security: Users are responsible for maintaining the secrecy of their unique password and account information at all times.
19. Data Erasure: Allows users to request data erasure when it is no longer relevant or incorrect.
20. Data Portability: Allows users to move their data to other service providers as they wish.
21. Child Privacy: Committed to protecting the privacy of children under 16 years of age and does not collect personally identifiable information from any person known to be under 16.
22. Data Transfer and Storage: May transfer, store, and process user data outside the country in which the user resides, with a Data Protection Addendum governing these transfers.

Adventure Academy.Security Practices: Employment of commercially reasonable physical, technical, and administrative security measures including industry-standard SSL encryption for data transmission, data encryption, firewalls, and physical access controls to buildings and files; periodic audits of security to apply best practices and reasonable industry standards; limiting access to user information to those employees who require it to perform their job functions; use of Member IDs for authentication and monitoring compliance; account holders create a password in the registration process, which can help protect against unauthorized access to the Account and PI by selecting and protecting the password appropriately (Two-factor authentication may be used for account access); implementation of cookies, pixel tags, or IFrames for Adult Users’ visits to the non-child-directed portions of the Services; use of third-party advertising networks and affiliates adhering to their own privacy policies for delivering interest-based advertising, subject to opt-out options; compliance with applicable laws regarding data retention, such as deleting PI in active databases associated with an account if the account remains inactive for 24 months (unless otherwise stated in the Privacy Policy); retaining certain data relevant to preventing fraud or future abuse, account recovery, or customer support, and all subject to internal records retention periods; providing commercially reasonable efforts to honor requests from California residents to access, change, delete, or port their PI, in compliance with the CCPA; implementing written contracts with third-party recipients that describe the purposes for which personal information is shared, require confidentiality, and prohibit using the disclosed information for any purpose except performing the contract; notification of users where required by law or deemed necessary and appropriate under the circumstances if there is a breach of security; the company only asks for Personal Information (PI) where it serves a business purpose and tries to limit the collection of PI to only what is necessary to accomplish those purposes; Payment information is encrypted and stored securely, with only the first six digits and last four digits retained for Account identification purposes; the Services do not support social or federated login, which helps reduce the risk of unauthorized access to user accounts; Child Users' PI is protected under COPPA (Children's Online Privacy Protection Act) regulations, as Adventure Academy is certified under kidSAFE’s FTC approved COPPA Safe Harbor program; Adult Users can request to review, delete, or cease collecting PI about Child Users associated with their Account at any time; External links are only accessible if an Adult User enters his or her password, which helps protect Child Users from accessing potentially harmful content; Information collected from users may be used for various purposes including security purposes (such as password protection in the Parent Section), fulfilling purchases, responding to inquiries, and providing customer service; Information may be shared with third parties who perform certain services for the company, such as processing payments or filtering chat content, these providers are required to keep the information confidential and use it only for purposes permitted by this Privacy Policy; the company may disclose user data when required by law or legal process, to comply with requests from public and government authorities, or to protect its operations, rights, privacy, safety, or property; In the event of a corporate transaction (such as an acquisition, merger, or asset sale), the acquirer shall be subject to the same commitments stated under this Privacy Policy.

Me: Reflect for Self Awareness.Security Practices: Data is stored locally on users' smartphones and encrypted for additional security, with users having full control over their data. Users should ensure their smartphones are secure and not compromised, avoiding providing root access (e.g., 'jailbreaking'). Users are advised to keep login credentials secure and not share them with others. During registration, email addresses and the operating system of users' smartphones are collected for creating user accounts and providing access to the Me App, which are stored securely and deleted upon request or contract termination. During login, an external server checks if the app is up-to-date, processing only the IP address of the user’s smartphone without storing any data. Feedback surveys are anonymized, and email addresses for technical support are processed separately and not associated with users. Users can backup their journaling data and self-reflection exercises, which are encrypted and can be exported to third-party storage locations using a provided Recovery Key. For Premium users, encrypted backups are automatically saved in their personal Google Drive cloud storage. Free users can choose the time and location for their backup. The app does not store any personal data during the sharing functionality. Users have various rights under data protection law, including requesting a copy of all information collected, processed, and stored about them at any time, demanding deletion and/or correction of their personal data, withdrawing consent to the processing of their personal data at any time with immediate termination of local data processing, and complaining to a data protection authority if they believe their data has been mishandled. In case of inconsistency or conflict between the English and German versions of the Privacy Policy, the German version shall prevail.

UBA Mobile Banking.Security Practices:
Data Collection and Processing: Secure collection and processing of user's personal data in accordance with banking regulations and legal requirements.
Confidentiality and Disclosure: Personal data kept confidential unless required by law or for banking services, with a legal basis for processing.
Compliance with Information Security Standards: Compliance with PCI-DSS, ISO/IEC 27001:2022, etc.
Data Retention: Personal data not kept longer than necessary and compliance with all statutory and regulatory requirements concerning the retention of personally identifiable information.
Server Protection: Web servers protected behind firewalls and systems monitored to prevent unauthorized access.
Email Security: Confidential information not sent by ordinary email due to security concerns.
Access Control: Access to personal data limited to authorized staff, agents, and contractors who have agreed to keep information secure and confidential.
User Responsibility: Users responsible for keeping bank account details secret and confidential, and informing UBA if they suspect their credentials have been compromised.

Remedies for Personal Data Violation: Investigation, reporting to authorities, recovery, correction, and enhancement of controls around personal data if a violation occurs.
Cross-Border Transfer: No transfer of personal data to foreign countries or international organizations in contravention of applicable Data Protection Laws.
Policy Updates: Regular review of Privacy Policy with updates placed on the website (www.ubagroup.com).
Contact Information: Various methods available for users to contact UBA for questions, concerns, or comments about their privacy policy.
Supervisory Authority: Users may engage the supervisory authority (Nigeria Data Protection Commission) if they wish to complain about how UBA handles or has handled their personal data or have concerns about how their complaint has been handled.

Idle Pet Shelter - Cat Rescue.Security Practices:
The service employs several security methods to protect user's data, including: 
1. Data Collection: Minimum necessary data is collected for providing services, with no collection from children under 18 years of age.
2. Data Protection Rights: Users have rights such as requesting deletion, restriction or objection to processing, data portability, opt-out of personal information sale, and be free from discrimination for exercising these rights.
3. Authorized Agents: Users can designate an authorized agent to make requests on their behalf.
4. Data Transfer in Business Transactions: User data may be transferred in the event of a merger, acquisition, or asset sale, with notice provided before it becomes subject to a different Privacy Policy.
5. Disclosure of Personal Data: Personal data may be disclosed under certain circumstances such as compliance with legal obligations, protecting rights and property, preventing wrongdoing, and ensuring user safety.
6. Security Measures: Administrative, technical, and physical security measures are in place to protect user data from unauthorized access or against loss, misuse, or alteration.
7. Periodic Reviews: Personal data is periodically reviewed for deletion when no longer needed for the intended purpose or to comply with legal obligations.
8. Opt-out of Targeted Advertising: Users can opt-out of targeted advertising by checking their privacy settings on Android and iOS devices.
9. Third-Party Websites: Users are advised to review the privacy policies of any third-party sites they visit, as the company has no control over and assumes no responsibility for the content, privacy policies, or practices of these sites.
10. Contact Us: Users can contact the company at biz@outloud.games if they have questions about data protection or need to resolve issues with their personal data.

Combat Master Mobile FPS.Security Practices:
Data Collection and Use: Personal information is collected for service provision and improvement, with limited use or sharing as described in the Privacy Policy.

Patch Prioritization: Vulnerabilities are classified based on industry-standard severity ratings (CVSS), and updates are prioritized accordingly.
Monitoring and Accountability: Automated patching for operating systems and antivirus software, immediate updating of browsers and applications upon receiving vendor notifications, monthly audits to verify compliance and detect missed updates, and developer training in secure coding practices.
Data Deletion: Users can delete their personal data through specific steps within the app.
Log Data Collection: The app collects log data when there is an error, which may include device information and statistics.
Use of Cookies: Although the app does not use cookies explicitly, it may utilize third-party code and libraries that do to collect information and improve services.
Third-Party Service Providers: Alfa Bravo Inc employs third-party companies but obligates them not to disclose or use information for any other purpose.
Data Protection: Although Alfa Bravo Inc strives to protect user data using commercially acceptable means, they cannot guarantee absolute security due to internet transmission and electronic storage insecurities.
Links to Other Sites: The app may contain links to other sites, but users are advised to review the Privacy Policies of these websites as Alfa Bravo Inc has no control over or responsibility for their content, privacy policies, or practices.
Children's Privacy: The app does not knowingly collect personally identifiable information from children under 13 years of age; any such data will be immediately deleted.
Policy Updates: Alfa Bravo Inc may periodically update their Privacy Policy, and users are advised to review this page regularly for changes.
Contact Information: Users can contact Alfa Bravo Inc at alfabravogames@gmail.com with any questions or suggestions about their Privacy Policy.

Sony | Sound Connect.Security Practices:
Authentication/Authorization: Cookies, tokens, and other technologies for authentication and authorization with the Sony account for Home Entertainment & Sound Products (Sony account for HES). Users can manage their passwords through a security question and answer and telephone number.
Data Encryption: Employs encryption of sensitive information to protect collected data.
Access Control: Access to collected data is limited to authorized employees, agents, contractors, and third parties with a legitimate business need. Third-party service providers are required to maintain appropriate security measures.
Data Retention: Personal information is retained for as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes outlined in the privacy policy or as required by law. After this period, they either delete the personal information or de-identify it.
Data Protection Officer (DPO): A DPO responsible for overseeing compliance with data protection laws and regulations.
Regular Reviews: Regularly reviews and updates its security practices and measures to ensure they remain effective in protecting users' data.
Incident Response: Established procedures to respond promptly and effectively to data breaches.
Password Management: Users can register a security question and answer and telephone number at the Sony account for HES security setting page for password management and authentication purposes.
Data Sharing: Personal information is shared with third parties only for business purposes or when required by law, ensuring these third parties protect users' data. Users have opt-out options for certain data sharing practices.
Opt-Out Options: Users can opt-out of the 'sale' or sharing of their personal information for cross context behavioral advertising by disabling certain settings within the application.
Data Protection: Shares personal information with affiliates, IT service providers, hosting service providers, business transfer recipients, customer service providers, government authorities/law enforcement officials, auditors, and external consultants (e.g., lawyers, tax accountants). These entities are expected to protect users' data in accordance with Sony's privacy policy.
Duty of Confidentiality: Imposes a duty of confidentiality on its personnel handling personal information.
Data Minimization: Collects only the necessary personal information and uses it for the purposes stated at the point of collection or as otherwise noted in the privacy policy.
Right to Rectify Inaccurate Personal Information: Users have the right to rectify inaccurate personal information maintained by Sony.
Withdrawal of Consent: Users may request withdraw previously provided consent to process their personal information.
Location Data Collection and Opt-Out: Automated technologies are used to collect location data with user consent, and users can opt-out of profiling and location tracking by disabling certain settings within the applications.
Designated Request Mechanism: Provides a designated request mechanism for California and Nevada residents to exercise their rights regarding their personal information.
Contact Information for Privacy Officer: Users have the option to submit a complaint to the Commission d'accès à l'information du Québec (CAI) if they are not satisfied with how their data is being handled, and contact information for Sony's Privacy Officer is provided.

NYP Connect.Security Practices:
The privacy policy outlines the following security practices and user rights:
1. Compliance with federal and state laws regarding health care privacy.
2. Maintaining the privacy and security of protected health information as required by law, promptly notifying individuals if a breach occurs that may have compromised the privacy or security of their information.
3. Using or sharing an individual's information only as described in the notice, unless they give written permission to do so, and allowing them to change their mind at any time.
4. Implementing appropriate data security policies and measures such as encryption, access controls, and regular audits to protect users' health information.
5. Participation in health information exchanges that share health information electronically with other healthcare providers, as permitted by New York and federal law.
6. Ensuring compliance with the Department of Health and Human Services if it wants to see that they are complying with federal privacy law.
7. Implementing measures to respond to organ and tissue donation requests, working with medical examiners or funeral directors when an individual dies, addressing workers' compensation, law enforcement, and other government requests, and responding to lawsuits and legal actions as required by law.
8. Providing users with the right to request access to their electronic or paper medical record and certain other health information, and allowing them to ask for corrections if they believe there are errors in their records.
9. Implementing a Location Services Privacy Policy that utilizes GPS and Bluetooth technology to approximate location, but the user's location information is anonymous, not stored, not used to track movement within facilities, shared or sold in any way, and only utilized with the user's permission while at the facilities.
10. Offering confidential communications options such as home or office phone or sending mail to a different address for users who request it.

Onet - Connect & Match Puzzle.Security Practices:
BoomBox Games has several security practices and measures in place to protect users' data:
1. Data storage: They use cloud service providers like Amazon Web Services (AWS) for data storage, which is based in the U.S.
2. Customer support solution: They work with Zendesk Inc. for managing and responding to customer questions and complaints.
3. Analytics providers: They collaborate with various analytics, segmentation, and mobile measurement service providers to understand their userbase. Users should research each provider's security practices to ensure they have adequate measures in place to protect user data.
4. Advertising partners: They share certain information with advertising partners who will use it to serve ads within their games. Users can find a list of partners on BoomBox Games' website for more information about each partner’s security practices.
5. Payment processors: They work with payment processors like Google, Apple App Store payments, and Huawei to handle transactions within their games.
6. Opt-out options: Users have the option to opt out of targeted advertising or change their device settings to limit personalized advertisements.
7. Data processing agreements (DPA): It is not explicitly stated whether they have data processing agreements in place with third parties. Users should contact BoomBox Games directly for more information about their DPAs.
8. Data retention: Users may request to delete their data, but the policy does not specify how long they retain user data before deletion. Users should reach out to BoomBox Games' support team for more details on their data retention policies.
9. Security Measures: The company has security measures in place to maintain the privacy and integrity of user Information.
10. Data Minimization: They may take extra steps to protect your Information and minimize the amount of data they process.
11. Data Storage: Your Information is kept for as long as you are using their games, and then for up to three years from the date you stop interacting with the games. When deleting Information, they will take measures to make the Information irrecoverable or irreproducible, and electronic files which contain Information will be deleted permanently.
12. Data Transfer: When transferring your Information outside the UK or the EEA, they may transfer it to countries that have been recognized as offering an adequate protection by the EEA or the UK. When this adequacy status has not been offered, they use standard contracts that can be used in the EEA or the UK to safeguard your Information while transferring it outside the EEA or the UK.
13. Data Protection Representative: They have appointed a data protection representative in the United Kingdom.
14. Advertising and User Acquisition Partners: They work with user acquisition and advertising partners who are required to follow certain privacy practices, and users can opt-out of targeted advertisements through the in-app settings or by using their web form.
15. Verification of requests: Requests for access to or deletion of Personal Information are subject to reasonable verification of the user's identity.
16. Authorized agent: Users can authorize an agent to make a request on their behalf by emailing legal@Boomboxgames.net.
17. Data retention and response time: The company aims to fulfill all verified requests within 45 days pursuant to the CCPA, with extensions for an additional 45 days if necessary, accompanied by an explanation for the delay.
18. No rent, sell, or share of Personal Information: The company does not rent, sell, or share Personal Information with nonaffiliated companies for their direct marketing uses as contemplated by California’s ‘Shine the Light’ law (Civil Code § 1798.83), unless they have your permission.
19. No response to Do Not Track signals: There is no accepted standard on how to respond to Do Not Track signals, and the company does not respond to such signals.
